description: {"blocks":[{"key":"9itv6","text":"Colorimetric assay for direct (vs. enzymatic) measurement of urea to a detection limit of 0.4 µM concentration. The reaction of urea with diacetylmonoxime (DAM) to form a colored product is enhanced by addition of thiosemicarbazide (TSC). The original direct method was adapted for use with a single mixed reagent and incubation at room temperature (vs. the “high temperature direct method” that incubates at 85ºC for 30 minutes). NOTE: This protocol is written for measurement in 24-well plates.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":431,"length":64}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
materials_text: {"blocks":[{"key":"ctc0t","text":"Spectrophotometer (or plate reader),","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"aa1b5","text":"200 and 1000 µL pipettes,","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5quhc","text":"Tube racks,","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"57fsa","text":"Vortexer;","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2r5t8","text":"200 and 1000 µL filter tips,","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7ekue","text":"5 mL polypropylene tubes,","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1j3vm","text":"24-well microplate with lid, clear,","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9s0ic","text":"fresh Reagent A,","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"177nd","text":"fresh COLDER reagent.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

status.info: We use this protocol and it’s working

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"ab7e7","text":"Making Reagents and Solutions","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1rqq9","text":"Diacetylmonoxime (DAM) solution: Dissolve 3.4 g in 100 mL nanopure or LC-MS water (34 g L-1 or 0.3363 M stock). Store solution at 4°C in dark. Stable for at least 1 month. ","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":31},{"style":"UNDERLINE","offset":0,"length":31},{"style":"sup","offset":89,"length":2}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2fj7c","text":"a. Also known as 2,3-butanedione monoxime.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9iiia","text":"b. Dissolve using rotisserie (hybridization oven) set to room temp (prop open door).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"bfkls","text":"Thiosemicarbazide (TSC) solution: Dissolve 0.19 g in 20 mL nanopure water (9.5 g L-1 or 0.104235 M stock). Store solution at 4°C in dark. Stable for at least 1 month. a.Dissolve using rotisserie (hybridization oven) set to room temp (prop open door).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":32},{"style":"UNDERLINE","offset":0,"length":32},{"style":"sup","offset":82,"length":2}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"dk2f8","text":"Reagent A solution: Mix 25 parts DAM with 1 part TSC. Make fresh prior to each analysis. (32.7 g L-1 or 0.3234 M DAM and 0.365 g L-1or 0.004 M TSC) ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":18},{"style":"italic","offset":54,"length":33},{"style":"UNDERLINE","offset":0,"length":18},{"style":"sup","offset":98,"length":2},{"style":"sup","offset":130,"length":2}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7lrlv","text":"Ferric chloride (hexahydrate) solution: Dissolve 0.15 g ferric chloride (FeCl3, 6H2O) in 10 mL nanopure water (15 g L-1 or 0.0554877 M stock). Store solution at 4°C in dark.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":38},{"style":"UNDERLINE","offset":0,"length":38},{"style":"sub","offset":77,"length":1},{"style":"sub","offset":82,"length":1},{"style":"sup","offset":117,"length":2}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8a116","text":"Reagent B solution: Add 300 mL concentrated sulfuric acid (~98% or 18.4 M) to 535 mL nanopure water (final concentration H2SO4 = 35.2% or 6.6 M). Add 0.5 mL ferric chloride solution to diluted acid (8.977 mg L-1 or 0.03321 mM stock). Store solution at 4°C in dark. Stable for at least 1 month.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":18},{"style":"UNDERLINE","offset":0,"length":18},{"style":"sub","offset":122,"length":1},{"style":"sub","offset":125,"length":1},{"style":"sup","offset":209,"length":2}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"dkjj1","text":"Color developing reagent (COLDER): Mix 1 part of Reagent A with 3.2 parts of Reagent B. Use within 15 minutes. a.Turbidity blank solution: Substitute nanopure water for Reagent A above for determination of optical turbidity blank.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":33},{"style":"italic","offset":88,"length":21},{"style":"UNDERLINE","offset":0,"length":33},{"style":"bold","offset":88,"length":21}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"9a3k","text":"Assay set-up.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5k4og","text":"Label four polypropylene tubes for each sample and all standards (7) (includes triplicate reactions and single turbidity blanks).NOTE: Assay requires \u003e8 mL of each sample and standard (includes replication).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"UNDERLINE","offset":6,"length":4}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"e9ih5","text":"Calculate total volume of COLDER reagent needed to run triplicate reactions for each standard and sample: (7 standards + # samples + 1 extra) x 3 x 0.6 mL = total vol (mL).a.If quantifying urea from 2 samples: 7+2+1 = 10 x3x0.6 = 18 mL reagent.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"UNDERLINE","offset":26,"length":14},{"style":"italic","offset":174,"length":70}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"fnt2r","text":"Calculate total volume of turbidity blank solution needed to run duplicates for each standard and sample: (7 standards + # samples + 1 extra) x 2 x 0.6 mL = total vol (mL). a.If quantifying urea from 2 samples: 7+2+1 = 10 x2x0.6 = 12 mL blank solution.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"UNDERLINE","offset":26,"length":24},{"style":"italic","offset":175,"length":77}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6mlh0","text":"Aliquot 2 mL of each sample and all standards into corresponding reaction tubes. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"57rnj","text":"Prepare the volumes of COLDER reagent and turbidity blank solution needed by mixing 1 part of Reagent A (or nanopure water) with 3.2 parts of Reagent B as described below. Use reagent within 15 minutes. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":172,"length":29},{"style":"italic","offset":172,"length":29}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"arhop","text":"a.If need 18 mL, mix 4.5 mL of Reagent A with 14.4 mL of Reagent B (18.9 mL). ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4j2nu","text":"b.If need 12 mL, mix 3 mL of nanopure water with 6 mL of Reagent B (12.6 mL).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"85civ","text":"Add 0.6 mL of COLDER reagent (or turbidity blank) to each reaction tube. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"c9mmn","text":"a. DAM: 1.7963 g L-1 or 0.01777 M final concentration","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sup","offset":18,"length":2}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3k6co","text":"b.TSC: 0.02008 g L-1 or 0.0002203 M final concentration","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sup","offset":18,"length":2}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"eq0pn","text":"c.FeCl3: 0.001578 g L-1 or 0.00000584 M (5.84 µM)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sub","offset":6,"length":1},{"style":"sup","offset":21,"length":2}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7na95","text":"d.H2SO4: 6.2% or 1.16 M final concentration","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sub","offset":3,"length":1},{"style":"sub","offset":6,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"qcuf","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2m8rr","text":"Mix (vortex) and incubate in the dark at room temperature (~22ºC) for 3 days.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ed5o0","text":"After 72 hours, transfer/pour entire 2.6 mL volume of each reaction into corresponding wells of 24-well plates and measure absorbance on plate reader.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"eboch","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"f8tk1","text":"Reading plates.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4pcbq","text":"Turn on Tecan Infinite 200 PRO plate reader 20-30 minutes prior to use.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"c817s","text":"Once warmed up, open the iControl software on MLCLab-PC.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"4u4l9","text":"Open file “Revilla_urea_24well”.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"dk7o6","text":"Load the plate—check whether the “plate with cover” box is checked (since using clear plates for this, can be read with lid on).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"upl2","text":"Read absorbance at 520±9 nm (25 flashes). Program automatically opens an Excel file that documents read parameters and data. ‘Save as’ before measuring 2nd plate.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sup","offset":153,"length":2}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"510jj","text":"Analyzing data.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"dali2","text":"Subtract the average absorbance of sample turbidity blanks from the absorbance of the samples treated with COLDER reagent (= corrected sample absorbance).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8mabf","text":"Subtract the average absorbance of the nanopure water tubes (i.e., 0 µM urea) treated with turbidity blank solution from the absorbances of all the standards. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"feq4m","text":"Plot corrected absorbance (y) vs. concentration (x) for all standards to establish a standard curve with linear regression. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"bd06b","text":"Use the equation of the standard curve to calculate sample concentration from absorbance.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"dneks","text":"Making Standards.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"35uuc","text":"Prepare 200 µM stock solution. Dilute 1:500 from 0.1 M solution =\u003e 20 µL + 9.980 mL nanopure water.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bba1q","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"e7k31","text":"Dilute the stock solution to the following concentrations in nanopure water: 0, 0.5, 1.25, 2.5, 5, 7.5, 10  µM.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

title: Measuring urea concentrations in water samples

versions.title: Measuring urea concentrations in water samples
